hanzi-su-wiki:
沼

Значения

Болото

Мнемоника

Болото, где вода 氵 призывает 召, иначе говоря, засасывает.
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhǎo
pond; pool
пруд; бассейн
rtega_mnemonic:
沼沼RSlake, fishpond, swamps
  • summoned 召 (unnatural) body of water 氵
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 召 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
沼气 [ zhǎo qì ]: marsh gas; methane CH4
沼泽 [ zhǎo zé ]: marsh; swamp; wetlands; glade
沼泽地 [ zhǎo zé dì ]: marsh; swamp; everglade
泥沼 [ ní zhǎo ]: swamp
湖沼 [ hú zhǎo ]: lakes and marshes
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 召 [ zhào ] imperial decree; to summon, to call, to beckon
heisig_chinese_memo: A marsh is a piece of land which has summoned (absorbed) the water above.
heisig_constituent: marsh, water, water droplets, water pistol, summon, seduce, sword, dagger, mouth
heisig_story: Unlike the meadow with its cliffs, the marshlands are low and near a source of water that feeds them until they get soggy through and through. Why certain land becomes marshy is probably due to the fact that it felt thirsty, and so tried its best to seduce the water over to its side. But, like most inordinate seductions, the last state of the victim is worse than the first. Hence the slushy marsh.
koohiiStory1: The marshlands near Mordor seduce Frodo into gazing upon them, and he falls into the water--splash!
koohiiStory2: A marsh is where water is seduced into the ground.
jp_example_words: 沼(ぬま): swamp, bog, pond, lake
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tsunami can't resist the call of a bog. Whenever a tsunami is headed toward land, a bog will always call out to it, "Hey tsunami, don't you want to hit me with your water? Come this way~"
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Close your eyes and hear the bog's temping call.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you listen to the bog's call you realize it looks just like the Numa (ぬま) Numa guy in your mind. You open your eyes and it's just a bog. You close your eyes, and there he is. The Numa Numa guy.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: So that's what happened to him! If you're a youngun, just do a little Google and you'll be pretty pleased, I'm sure.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 召 (めす、ショウ вызывать, потреблять). Не путать: 招 (まねく、ショウ приглашать, звать).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the water (氵) was summoned (召) and became a marsh
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A marsh is a piece of land which has summoned (absorbed) the water above.
humanum_full_description_en: From " water ", " call " sound. The original meaning is a pool. "Said Wen": "Marsh, pond water. From the water, call the sound." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "New Years Day": "Fish lies in the marsh, but also bandits and music." Mao Chuan: "Marsh, the pond." "Mencius. "Liang Hui Wang": "The king of Wen regards the power of the people as a marsh, and when the people are happy, it is called a spiritual marsh, and the marsh is called a spiritual marsh. It is happy that there are elk, fish and turtles."
humanum_short_description_en: From " water ", " call " sound. The original meaning is a pool.
humanum_full_description: 從「水」，「召」聲。本義是水池。《說文》：「沼，池水。从水，召聲。」如《詩．小雅．正月》：「魚在于沼，亦匪克樂。」毛傳：「沼，池也。」《孟子．梁惠王上》：「文王以民力為臺為沼，而民歡樂之，謂其臺曰靈臺，謂其沼曰靈沼，樂其有麋鹿魚鼈。」

沼(ぬま): swamp, bog, pond, lake

從「 水 」，「 召 」聲。本義是水池。《說文》：「沼，池水。从水，召聲。」如《詩．小雅．正月》：「魚在于沼，亦匪克樂。」毛傳：「沼，池也。」《孟子．梁惠王上》：「文王以民力為臺為沼，而民歡樂之，謂其臺曰靈臺，謂其沼曰靈沼，樂其有麋鹿魚鼈。」
From " water", " call" sound. The original meaning is a pool. "Said Wen": "Marsh, pond water. From the water, call the sound." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "New Years Day": "Fish lies in the marsh, but also bandits and music." Mao Chuan: "Marsh, the pond." "Mencius. "Liang Hui Wang": "The king of Wen regards the power of the people as a marsh, and when the people are happy, it is called a spiritual marsh, and the marsh is called a spiritual marsh. It is happy that there are elk, fish and turtles."

沼字的基本解释

沼
zhǎo
池子：池沼。沼地。沼泽。沼气（化学名词，即“甲烷”）。

沼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhǎo］
［《廣韻》之少切，上小，章。］
(1)水池。
(2)池水。

沼字的英文翻译

◎ 沼
billabong, natural pond

沼字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　沼； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页614第09
【唐韻】之少切【集韻】【正韻】止少切【韻會】止小切，?昭。上聲。【說文】池也。一說圓曰池，曲曰沼。【詩·召南】于沼于沚。　又【集韻】之笑切，音照。義同。

沼字的源字形

沼字的起名意思

水池，积水的洼地。

Name meaning
Pools, depressions with water.
沼
形声字。水(氵)表意,篆书形体像一道流水,表示水池;召(zhao)表声,召有引来一义,表示沼会引来周围的流水。本
义是天然的水池。
天然的水池子:~泽「池~。

Пиктофонетические символы.
Вода (氵) выражает значение, сценарий печати подобен потоку воды, что означает бассейн; чжао (zhao) выражает звук, и зов имеет то же значение, что означает, что болото привлечет окружающую воду.
Первоначальное значение - природный бассейн.
Природный бассейн: ~ Ze "pool ~".

Radicals: 氵, 召  (tsunami, call)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tsunami can't resist the call of a bog. Whenever a tsunami is headed toward land, a bog will always call out to it, "Hey tsunami, don't you want to hit me with your water? Come this way~"
Close your eyes and hear the bog's temping call.
Reading Mnemonic
As you listen to the bog's call you realize it looks just like the Numa (ぬま) Numa guy in your mind. You open your eyes and it's just a bog. You close your eyes, and there he is. The Numa Numa guy.
So that's what happened to him! If you're a youngun, just do a little Google and you'll be pretty pleased, I'm sure.
